data.question: _________almost fainted when he heard that some students were caught on the school's basketball court at night having sex.
data.section: This question is based on Bolaji Abdullahi's Sweet Sixteen
data.solution: In page 39, Mr Bello is the receiver of this information. It is safest to say Option C is the answer.

data.question: Adoringly, Aliya was referred to as ________
data.section: This question is based on Bolaji Abdullahi's Sweet Sixteen
data.solution:
Mr Bello calls his daughter, Aliya, 'First lady'

See page 2

data.question: KOTL means ___________
data.section: This question is based on Bolaji Abdullahi's Sweet Sixteen
data.solution:
KOTL means 'Kiss On The Lips'

See page 31

data.question: How old was Aliya in the Novel?
data.section: This question is based on Bolaji Abdullahi's Sweet Sixteen
data.solution: The text made references of years before Aliya turned 16, however, Aliya is sixteen (16). This is evident in page 1, sentence 3.

data.question: Mr Bello is a/an _______ by profession in the novel?
data.section: This question is based on Bolaji Abdullahi's Sweet Sixteen
data.solution:
Mr Bello is a Journalist. 

See page 1, Paragraph 5.

data.section: In the following options lettered A to D, all the words except one have the same stress pattern.
data.solution: Option A, B and D has its stress on the second syllable except for Option C

data.section: In the following options lettered A to D, all the words except one have the same stress pattern.
data.solution: Physique has its stress on the second syllable as opposed to other options with the stress on the first syllable

data.question: The man, as well as the woman ________ arrested
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
In the rule of concord, 'when words such as, as well as, alongside, together with, no less than etc are used, the verb that follows would be the same with the subject of the phrase or clause, that is, the noun or the pronoun that comes before the marker of accompaniment.

'The man' is a singular noun hence a singular verb is needed.

Note that 'arrested' can function as past tense or past participle but in this context, it is a past participle.

However, 'is' is a singular verb used in the present tense, 'has' is a singular used in the perfect tense, 'have' is a singular and plural verb used in the perfect tense and 'been' is used in the perfect tense.

Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

data.question: Many a ____________ to understand me
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
In the rule of Concord, 'when many-a is used, the verb and the noun that follows must be singular'

Option B is the correct answer.

data.question: It is you that __________ to write the letter
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
The law of proximity states that any subject closest to the verb element controls the verb form.

The sentence has a singular subject 'it' and a plural subject 'you', hence a plural verb is needed because 'you' is closer.

Similarly, 'supposed' is most appropriate because of the relative clause 'that'. This implies that supposed functions as an 'adjective' in this context which means 'intended'

Option D is the correct answer.

data.question: My father _______ on the floor
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
My Father' as the subject is in the third person category, should be followed by the auxiliary verb 'has' 

Think of the verb 'lie' as a word with two different meaning.

The first 'lie' means 'to rest in a horizontal position' The following are its past, present participle or past participle tense respectively, (lay, lying , lain)

The second lie means 'to give false information' The following are its past, present participle or past participle tense respectively, (lied, lying, lied)

Contextually and grammatically option D is the correct answer.

data.question: This class __________students and teachers
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
Comprise means 'made up of'. Therefore, to say 'Comprises of/ Comprise of ' is a tautology.

Note that, singular verbs must agree with a singular noun.

The subject of the sentence is 'This Class' which is a singular noun

This makes Option B correct.

data.question: Before I arrived, the choir _______ the hymn
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
Option C is the correct answer.

In the arrangement of tenses, 'when the main clause is in past or past perfect tense, the subordinate clause must be in the past or past perfect tense'.

'had' is used to express a past perfect tense as opposed to 'has' and 'have' which is used to express a present perfect tense.

data.question: The soldier _________ his gun on the wall after the armed robber______
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
Option B is the correct answer.

In the arrangement of tenses, 'when the main clause is in past or past perfect tense, the subordinate clause must be in the past or past perfect tense'.

'had' is used to express a past perfect tense as opposed to 'has' which is used to express a present perfect tense

data.question: Thank you for the __________ of presenting my paper.
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Option C, 'Privilege' is the appropriate spelling

data.question: My brother graduated from university last year; he will soon_________
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution:
The appropriate verb to be used in this context is 'Convoke'

Note; the word 'Convocate' is archaic (no longer in use)

data.question: You need to __________your points
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Option C, 'Expatiate' is the appropriate spelling

data.question: ll the people in the bus died in that _________  accident
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Option C, Fatal best qualifies the noun 'accident'

data.question: All the ________ were stolen by the thieves
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Option B is the appropriate spelling.

data.question: What a ________! the more you look, the less you see
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: The more you look, the less you see is contradictory and that is a paradox.

data.question: The soldiers pledge their ________ loyalty to the new government
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Option C best completes the sentence above. 'Complete' suggests 'entire or total'

data.question: After interrogation, the police ______ the information from the suspect.
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Option D, 'Obtained' means to gain or acquire. This option completes the above sentence.

data.question: Mr Cham will never tell you everything, he is very ________
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: For one who never tells you everything, 'Secrecy' best completes the sentence above.

data.question: Many countries no longer have _______ punishment as the penalty for murder
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: Capital punishment is also called 'death penalty', therefore in this context option C is the appropriate answer.s

data.question: __________ packages should always be handled with care
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: From the incomplete sentence, 'Fragile' as an adjective is the best option to qualify a package to be handled with care.

data.question: Because of the hard times, workers live in ___________ poverty
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
data.solution: From the above Options, Option C best describes the state of poverty

data.question: Our chief is very intelligent but he could be <u>parochial</u> in his judgements
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence
data.solution: Parochial means having a limited or narrow scope. Option C best fits this definition.

data.question: I went through his work; it was <u>gibberish</u>
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence
data.solution: Gibberish is a meaningless speech or writing. Option A is the correct answer

data.question: Coming late to work, according to Leonard, is <u>inimical</u> to the progress of the company
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence
data.solution: Inimical implies harmful

data.question: f he <u>declines</u> the offer, it will be better for him.
data.section: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence
data.solution: Declines simply means to reject

data.question: The appearance which the famous actor made last month was his swan song. This meant that_________

option.a: the actor sang beautifully during the play
option.b: the play was postponed because of the actor's non-appearance
option.c: the play was the actor's last appearance before he died
option.d: the last play was the actors best performance

data.section: After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of all or part of the sentences is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
data.solution: Swang Song means 'a final performance before death or retirement '

data.question: Muiz does not let the grass grow under his feet. This means that Muiz _________

option.a: does not waste time in doing things
option.c: cuts the grass in his field regularly

data.section: After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of all or part of the sentences is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
data.solution: This expression simply means not to hesitate to take action immediately.s

data.question: The Major demanded an <u>unalloyed</u> and not a __________ loyalty from his soldiers
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: unalloyed means not mixed, complete or unadulterated.

data.question: he economist argued that the apparently <u>inconsequential</u> rise in the price of petrol had a _________ effect on the cost of living
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: inconsequential simply means having no consequence. However, dangerous means the ability to cause harm. This makes option  C correct.

data.question: The exotic bird looked <u>resplendent</u>; its bright plumage contrasted with the rather _________ undergrowth
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Resplendent simply means shiny and colourful as opposed to Drab which means 'dull'

data.question: I thought that the comments made by the Manager were quite <u>innocuous</u> but the chairman considered them __________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: innocuous means harmless. This makes Option D the most appropriate answer.

data.question: My uncle is a <u>prosperous</u> businessman, my aunt, unfortunately, is quite ________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Unsuccessful implies 'not successful'. An opposite of Prosperous.

data.question: The University has a large <u>intake</u>, very few ________ take place
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: intake means the people taken into an organisation. Rejection is directly opposite in meaning to the word underlined.

data.question: Rather than make <u>derogatory<u/> remarks about the host, a guest should make ________ ones
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Derogatory implies 'to lessen one's value'. However, complimentary is an expression of praise.

data.question: Our <u>mechanised</u> services contrast sharply with the _________ operative we had before
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Mechanised' expresses 'the use of machines'. Manual implies 'the application of hand'

data.question: After Ade had listened to some advice, his <u>rigid</u> ideas became more ______________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Rigid' is the opposite of the word ''Flexible'. Rigid implies unbending as opposed to Flexible which means 'capable of being bent'

data.question: The policies of this government favour the <u>elite</u> rather than the _______________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Elite implies a special class of people or a selected group with superior status. Public means 'the people in general', however, masses gives a more defined group which implies 'the lower classes of persons'.

data.question: God opposes the <u>proud</u> and rewards the _________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Humble is the opposite of the adjective 'Proud'

data.question: The pilot says that it is easier to <u>take off</u> from the airport than to ___________ on the tarmac
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Land' in this context simply means ' to descend to a surface' This is an antonym of 'Take off' which means 'to leave the ground'

data.question: Although Chide's manners are quite <u>refined</u> , his colleagues are rather ___________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Refined implies to purify or to be free from impurities. Option B; crude, is a direct opposite to the word 'refine'' which means being in a natural state.

data.question: I am quite <u>outspoken</u> but my brother is __________
data.section: From the list of words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearest opposite in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time correctly fill in the gap in the sentence.
data.solution: Outspoken means speaking freely or openly. However, Taciturn means reserved in speech.
